entry.title: [Feature Request] Set file name automatically after dragging and dropping files in DevTools Snippets
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Drag and drop a file in Snippets editor 2. 3.
# Problem Description The file name is not automatically set in the panel.
For example plnkr https://plnkr.co has the capability described. When a file is dragged and dropped to the Project left panel the file name is automatically set.
Additionally we should also be able to
- Load local files as DevTools Snippets using switches on the command-line - Open file picker to select files to add to Snippets, automatically setting the file name in left panel
# Summary [Feature Request] Set file name automatically after dragging and dropping files in DevTools Snippets
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Dev \ Regression: No

entry.title: [Extensions] Let user change shortcut for the Omnibox API
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Install extension which uses Omnibox 2. Open chrome://settings/searchEngines and find the entry for the installed extension 3. Observe that there is no way to change the Omnibox keyword
# Problem Description This is a mirror bug for https://github.com/w3c/webextensions/issues/545
The request is to add a way for user to explicitly edit the extension omnibox keyword.
# Summary [Extensions] Let user change shortcut for the Omnibox API
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue Other browsers do not allow user to change the keyword.
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: PaymentRequest bug, [probably] does HTTP HEAD - Fails for manifests on GitHub.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Install the WebPKI suite. 2. Go to https://test.webpki.org/saturn 3. Perform a shop + checkout. 4. The page will say the app is not installed
Have worked flawlessly for 4 years.
# Problem Description PaymentRequest.show() throws an exception: The payment method "https://webpki.github.io/w3cpay/payment-manifest.json" is not supported. No "Link: rel=payment-method-manifest" HTTP header found at "https://webpki.github.io/w3cpay/payment-manifest.json".
# Summary PaymentRequest bug, [probably] does HTTP HEAD - Fails for manifests on GitHub.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Payments
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Breakpoints arent working
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open the developer tools 2. Type debugger 3. Nothing happens
# Problem Description If I type debugger in the developer tools, I expected to pause as if it were a breakpoint, but instead nothing happens. And if I place an actual breakpoint in my code, the breakpoint is ignored.
# Summary Breakpoints arent working
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Chromecast receiver not connecting after factory reset
entry.content:
Hi,
I've been developing a custom sender/receiver for the chromecast for the last year. Recently I've done a factory reset on the chromecast while installing a new router.
Just to be sure I've reapplied the chromecast for development, I am very positive the serial number is correct. As I've copied it before removal and I've triple checked.
However, suddenly I'm no longer able to connect my app to the chromecast. All I get is a session error `"session_error"` code and the casting popup in chrome says: `"Failed to cast, please try again."`. Since, recently you can no longer debug a casting device without running your custom app, I can't debug the app itself. Having said so, I've added a try/catch around my starting code which fetches a serialized error to my server.
The serialized error is never sent, I can't even see the router for the cast-receiver pop up in the logging. Making me suspect that the app isn't starting correctly. When I open the receiver app directly I see quite some websocket errors to `ws:localhost:8080` but I think that might just be due to the fact that it's not running in a chromecast in that situation.
Could you please help me figure out why it's not connecting/starting?
Thanks

entry.title: Google Chrome and other Electron apps don't observe custom ~/.XCompose sequences (Wayland)
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Chrome flags: `#ozone-platform-hint: auto` 2. Config files: ``` # ~/.config/chrome-flags.conf --ozone-platform-hint=auto --disable-features=WaylandFractionalScaleV1 ``` ``` # ~/.XCompose include "%L"
<Multi_key> <8> <8> : "∞" U221E # INFINITY ``` 3. Restart window manager (Sway for me, not tested elsewhere) 4. Open Chrome or any Electron app, focus a textbox, input `<compose> 8 8`
# Problem Description I am aware of https://issues.chromium.org/issues/41186472. However, many users have reported the issue as fixed, as well as the thread being marked obsolete with no way I can see to reopen the issue. On top of all of that, I am using Chrome with Wayland, which I imagine makes a unique enough case. ``sway version 0.3.2-26cdeeb (Dec 4 2023, branch 'master')``
# Summary Google Chrome and other Electron apps don't observe custom ~/.XCompose sequences (Wayland)
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Perf Insights crash when used at the same time
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open two browsers side by side (I'm meassuring CLS and the impact of a change on my page so I am comparing a prod vs test env pages on incognito mode) 2. Start "Meassure perf load" on Performance insights tab of the first broswer 3. Before the perf is finished do the same on the second browser
# Problem Description The second browser shows a handled error on the dev tools window and a button says "close". When clicked, the "Retrieving data" icon and text appears and never dissappears, and the whole dev tools is unusable (cannot navigate to other tabs)
# Summary Perf Insights crash when used at the same time
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:interactive_ui_tests/WallpaperSearchInteractiveTest.CustomizeButtonsWorkTogether - ninja://chrome/test:interactive_ui_tests/WallpaperSearchInteractiveTest.SearchesAndSetsNewAndHistoricalResults - ninja://chrome/test:interactive_ui_tests/WallpaperSearchInteractiveTest.FeedbackDialogShowsOnThumbsDown
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/85dd84c0ac791e9eb36c3a2ac4334c6d

entry.title: When you drag a file to Google Drive or Yandex Disk, the browser stops responding to the mouse.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Go to Google Drive or Yandex Disk. 2. I drag the file from the Dolphin into the Chromium window to upload it to the repository. 3. Chromium stops reacting to the mouse. Not a single click is triggered.
# Problem Description When you drag a file to Google Drive or Yandex Disk, the browser stops responding to the mouse. Chromium stops reacting to the mouse. Not a single click is triggered. But the download itself continues and the hotkeys are working. The mouse cursor moves, but the Browser does not respond to mouse clicks.
I don't know how long ago it stopped working, but a month ago everything was working fine.
# Summary When you drag a file to Google Drive or Yandex Disk, the browser stops responding to the mouse.
# Additional Data Category: Network / Downloading \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Unable to share whole screen on meeting sites like Gmeet, teams, skype etc.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Go to any meeting site 2. share screen > full screen 3. you cannot see your screen shared, it shows black screen to other meeting members
# Problem Description I am currently using Debian 12 with Wayland as the display server. I had previously installed Chromium using flatpaks and it was functioning perfectly. However, I am now facing difficulties in sharing my desktop screen during meetings on various applications. It shows Black Screen when I try to share the full desktop screen, but the tab sharing works well. idk how to solve this issue, Is it with wayland or anything idk.
# Summary Unable to share whole screen on meeting sites like Gmeet, teams, skype etc.
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug-Regression - Used to work, now broken
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.content:
This URL fails to load: https://source.chromium.org/search?q=raw_bssl_sys_bindings&ss=chromium
Confirmed on (a) Google corp (b) personal machine (c) personal machine incognito
Behavior is: see "Loading search results" and spinner for a while, then "Sorry, something went wrong". "Copy error trace" yields: `{"code":500,"message":"Internal error encountered.","status":"INTERNAL"}`

entry.title: [Custom Highlights] Slow performance with many highlights
entry.content:
Demo URL: https://cdpn.io/pen/debug/MWxLjEo/1fc408cf0f0e079596f3cac8efd569f1
Steps to reproduce:
(1) Visit https://cdpn.io/pen/debug/MWxLjEo/1fc408cf0f0e079596f3cac8efd569f1 (2) Paste the contents from https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.7.1.js into the code block shown on the page (3) (Try to) Scroll
The pasted in JavaScript code from (2) contains 63388 tokens. Each token is of a certain type (comment, number, class-name, …) and is assigned to one of the 33 registered Highlights (1 Highlight for each token type)
Scrolling is very laggy, with a long time spent on pre-paint as you scroll.

entry.title: scroll-margin is no longer taken into account when moving focus to entirely visible elements.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open https://jsbin.com/xovayad/24/edit?html,css,output 2. Click on "Item 1" 3. Press Tab to move focus to "Item 2". It works as expected 4. Press Tab to move focus to "Item 3". It should scroll "Item 3" to the middle of the container viewport, respecting the scroll-margin value, but it doesn't. 5. Press Tab to move focus to "Item 4". It works as expected.
# Problem Description When you press Tab to move focus to "Item 3", the scroll-margin value isn't respected if the element is fully visible within the container viewport.
Safari, Firefox, and Chrome 120 will scroll the element to the container viewport's center, honoring the scroll-margin value. Chrome 121, however, doesn't.
I've tested this with Chrome 122 Beta and 123 Dev, and the issue persists.
This becomes particularly troublesome when the container has sticky elements at the top or bottom. If an element is fully within the container viewport but obscured by a sticky element, and you use the scroll-margin property to ensure it remains fully visible below the sticky element when focused, the UI will now seem broken.
# Summary scroll-margin is no longer taken into account when moving focus to entirely visible elements.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Scroll
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: WebNN: De-duplicate data structures
entry.content:
Some examples I've recently noticed:
- `webnn::Operand` in _components/ml/webnn/graph_validation_utils.h_ has a comment suggesting that it should be kept up-to-date with corresponding `Operand` definition in _services/webnn/public/mojom/webnn_graph.mojom_. They have since diverged - `webnn::ElementWiseUnary` enum does not contain the `kCast` item that the mojo version has
In fact, it looks like most of the types declared in components/ml/webnn have duplicate definitions in mojo or V8. We should:
1. Remove duplicate data structures, if possible! 2. Otherwise, [enlist the compiler's help to enforce that these data structures stay in sync](https://crsrc.org/c/third_party/blink/renderer/modules/file_system_access/global_file_system_access.cc;l=204-211;drc=b388e927ed4f5c9ef43c899eae909195636af496)). Code comments are not compiled; `static_assert` is!

entry.title: Re-enable `GetIcon_Default` and `GetIcon_BookmarkIcon` on `linux-chromeos-chrome`builder
entry.content:
The `linux-chromeos-chrome` builder started crashing consistently when the `ChromeRefresh2023` flag was enabled by default in crrev/c/5247338. Further details regarding these crashes can be found in b/325116092.
I've already invested a bunch of time trying to investigate exactly why these failures are only occurring on this single CI builder, but have not had much success thus far.
As such, this bug has been filed to track any (long-term) work that needs to be done to re-enable these two tests on this particular builder.

entry.title: Account bookmarks should be cleared when signing out
entry.content: After a user has opted-into butter, their account-bound bookmarks should be removed from the device after signing out.
